intro: Draba helleriana, commonly known as Heller's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in crevices and on slopes. Draba helleriana is adapted to cold climates and is typically found at high elevations.
